content: We we diagnosed the same week last year. My son and I driving in an in between world space of dying tears and living wills from upstate NY to UPenn hospital for diagnostic confirmation and hopefully surgery. And I too am alive, through my son now knows where my ashes would have and may still be strewn. A ‘nuanced’ tumor was no match for the magically knowing hands of my surgeon and one year later I am alive to read your words and to know them. Thank you. This was meant for me.
